Posted By: luca_barelli (8/11/2011 8:04:30 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@sonorhC - What makes him deadlier than the others is that once you *start* landing hits with him, your opponent isn't likely to be able to recover. They won't be able to keep cards in their hand, and that really shuts people down. They can't plan long-term, they can't hold on to a trick for later, they can't keep a creature in hand to protect it from a kill spell. They're forced to play out or lose it, and they're forced into topdeck mode. That's devastating.  
  
You know, on top of the 7 damage per turn they're *already* taking.
posts.html:
@sonorhC - What makes him deadlier than the others is that once you start landing hits with him, your opponent isn't likely to be able to recover. They won't be able to keep cards in their hand, and that really shuts people down. They can't plan long-term, they can't hold on to a trick for later, they can't keep a creature in hand to protect it from a kill spell. They're forced to play out or lose it, and they're forced into topdeck mode. That's devastating.

You know, on top of the 7 damage per turn they're already taking.

posts.post_content: For those of you who play EDH, here's a quick history lesson. EDH stands for Elder Dragon Highlander. The Elder Dragon part was named after the five legend dragons that appeared in the set Ledgends. The most famous of the five is yours truly, Nicol Bolas. The Highlander part refers to the famous line of the movie **Highlander**, "There can only be one!" Meaning there can only be one copy of every card in an EDH deck, lead by a legendary creature!
posts.html:
For those of you who play EDH, here's a quick history lesson. EDH stands for Elder Dragon Highlander. The Elder Dragon part was named after the five legend dragons that appeared in the set Ledgends. The most famous of the five is yours truly, Nicol Bolas. The Highlander part refers to the famous line of the movie Highlander, "There can only be one!" Meaning there can only be one copy of every card in an EDH deck, lead by a legendary creature!

Posted By: metalevolence (11/1/2009 4:46:32 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
(Before anything, I just want to say that it looks like the dragon you all say he's going to eat is in the back ground to me and is likely not that much smaller than him up close)  
  
But, moving on. This is much better art, but not because he lacks a book. (I liked the book) more because he actually looks like a dragon and not a demon or something. Although, it takes slightly away from his appearance as an intelligent being. Let's face it, if this art were used for [Hellkite Overlord](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hellkite Overlord) noe of us would have known the difference.  
  
I think the artist should have kept the book somewhere in the art... (A dragon pulling a mid air back-flip while reading a book would have been awesome)
posts.html:

posts.post_content: Simply put one of the most beautiful cards in the entire game. Not only does it have ridiculously amazing artwork, that looks even better in the gold border with the FTV foil, but it is also really good in any timmy style deck. Throw him in Commander, Reanimator, or Cruel Control and you too will see the terrible power of [Nicol Bolas](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nicol Bolas). Oh and I nearly forgot to mention, dat flavour text!

posts.post_content:
sonorhC: I suppose those might be fair complaints, if this were printed in a regular set today.  
  
Please go look up [Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker) or read any of the MTG novels featuring this guy.  
  
.....  
  
done? THAT'S why. This particular card, like so many old cards, is actually not stupendously impressive anymore. But that's not the point. The point is, IT'S NICOL BOLAS. DO YOU KNOW WHAT HE'S DONE?! WHAT HE'S CAPABLE OF DOING?! This is how powerful he was BEFORE THE BEGINNING OF TIME. He shortly became a Planeswalker, and his Planeswalker card is what's LEFT OF HIM after nearly all the powers of the Spark are nerfed by the Mending.   
  
Nicol Bolas, Yawgmoth, Urza and Emrakul the Aeons Torn are hands down the Top 4 Most Powerful Beings in Magic. Nicol Bolas is older than at least two of them.
posts.html:
sonorhC: I suppose those might be fair complaints, if this were printed in a regular set today.

Please go look up Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker or read any of the MTG novels featuring this guy.

.....

done? THAT'S why. This particular card, like so many old cards, is actually not stupendously impressive anymore. But that's not the point. The point is, IT'S NICOL BOLAS. DO YOU KNOW WHAT HE'S DONE?! WHAT HE'S CAPABLE OF DOING?! This is how powerful he was BEFORE THE BEGINNING OF TIME. He shortly became a Planeswalker, and his Planeswalker card is what's LEFT OF HIM after nearly all the powers of the Spark are nerfed by the Mending.

Nicol Bolas, Yawgmoth, Urza and Emrakul the Aeons Torn are hands down the Top 4 Most Powerful Beings in Magic. Nicol Bolas is older than at least two of them.

Posted By: DarthParallax (3/7/2012 2:53:43 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Zoah: I'm pretty sure that with the Legends art, Beard was indeed trying for "demonic dragon". Kind of goes with the name. Nicol is derived from the German word for "devil", while Bolas is apparently some sort of demonic epithet. Exhibit A: The Goetic demon Glasya-Labolas...or, as his name is occasionally rendered, Glasya La \*Bolas\*.
posts.html:

Nicol is derived from the German word for "devil", while Bolas is apparently some sort of demonic epithet.
